title: Ragged Grids for ggplot2
text: ggragged extends faceting system ggplot2 ragged grids – hybrid layout facet_wrap() facet_grid(). facet_ragged_rows() groups panels rows (potentially) varying lengths. facet_ragged_cols() groups panels columns (potentially) varying lengths.

title: Ragged Grids for ggplot2
text: Ragged grids can used clearly separate nested hierarchies panel layout:
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggragged)  p <- ggplot(Indometh, aes(time, conc)) + geom_line()  # Panels for each subject, with cohorts on separate rows p + facet_ragged_rows(  vars(Cohort = 1 + Subject %in% 3:6),  vars(Subject = as.character(Subject)),  labeller = label_both ) # Panels for each subject, with cohorts in separate columns p + facet_ragged_cols(  vars(Subject = as.character(Subject)),  vars(Cohort = 1 + Subject %in% 3:6),  labeller = label_both )

title: Lay out panels in a ragged grid — facet_ragged
text: rows, cols set variables expressions quoted ggplot2::vars(), combinations define panels included grid. ... Arguments reserved future use. scales panels share scales ("fixed"), x-axes vary ("free_x"), y-axes vary ("free_y"), ("free")? Panels within groups always share scale along grouping dimension. labeller function takes one data frame labels returns list data frame character vectors. input column corresponds one factor. Thus one vars(cyl, ). output column gets displayed one separate line strip label. function inherit "labeller" S3 class compatibility labeller(). can use different labeling functions different kind labels, example use label_parsed() formatting facet labels. label_value() used default, check details pointers options.

title: Lay out panels in a ragged grid — facet_ragged
code: p <- ggplot(Indometh, aes(time, conc)) + geom_line()  # Panels for each subject, with cohorts on separate rows p + facet_ragged_rows(   vars(Cohort = 1 + Subject %in% 3:6),   vars(Subject = as.character(Subject)),   labeller = label_both )   # Independent y-axes between rows of cohorts p + facet_ragged_rows(   vars(Cohort = 1 + Subject %in% 3:6),   vars(Subject = as.character(Subject)),   labeller = label_both,   scales = "free_y" )   # Panels for each subject, with cohorts in separate columns p + facet_ragged_cols(   vars(Subject = as.character(Subject)),   vars(Cohort = 1 + Subject %in% 3:6),   labeller = label_both )   # Independent y-axes for all subjects p + facet_ragged_cols(   vars(Subject = as.character(Subject)),   vars(Cohort = 1 + Subject %in% 3:6),   labeller = label_both,   scales = "free_y" )
